alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 7:34AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Bureau and northern Putnam Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 733 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ladd to near Bureau Junction. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Hennepin, Spring Valley, DePue, Granville, Ladd, Tiskilwa, La Moille, Dalzell, Bureau Junction, Mark, Cherry, Malden, Seatonville, Standard, Milo, Arlington, Dover, Hollowayville and Coal Hollow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 55 and 72. Interstate 180 between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
